me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.drive

Class MeccanumDrive

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.drive.MeccanumDrive
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drive, Modifiable<Translation>

    public class MeccanumDrive
extends java.lang.Object
implements Drive
    Simple meccanum drive implementation. This implementation makes use of the RelativeMeccanumKinematics class to determine specific motor powers for each of the individual motors - front right, front left, back right, and back left. Because the RelativeMeccanumKinematics class is... well... relative, you don't need to input any measurements or anything.

    This class has a minimum power of 0.0 and a maximum power of 1.0. Additionally, motor powers are all normalized before being multiplied by a magnitude - this means if you want to drive straight forwards at full speed, your robot will only travel at ~0.71 speed.

    If, no matter what you do, you can't get your chassis to drive in the right direction, try using a modifier - this will change the inputted Translations so your robot can correctly follow them.

    Since:
    0.0.0
    Author:
    Colin Robetson

      • MeccanumDrive

        public MeccanumDrive(Motor fr,
                     Motor fl,
                     Motor br,
                     Motor bl,
                     Angle angleOffset,
                     boolean swapXY,
                     boolean reflectX,
                     boolean reflectY)
        Create a new MeccanumDrive with a modifier.
        Parameters:
        fr - the front-right motor.
        fl - the front-left motor.
        br - the back-right motor.
        bl - the back-left motor.
        angleOffset - the angle offset to apply to any inputted translations.
        swapXY - should input translations have their X and Y values swapped? This is the very first modifier that gets applied - if X and Y values are swapped, and you set reflectX to true, you'll be reflecting what were originally Y values.
        reflectX - should X values be reflected across the Y axis? Try changing this if your robot isn't moving in the right direction.
        reflectY - should Y values be reflected across the X axis? Try changing this if your robot isn't moving in the right direction.

      • MeccanumDrive

        public MeccanumDrive(Motor fr,
                     Motor fl,
                     Motor br,
                     Motor bl,
                     Angle angleOffset,
                     double minMagnitude,
                     double maxMagnitude,
                     double turnMagnitude,
                     boolean swapXY,
                     boolean invertX,
                     boolean invertY)
        Create a new MeccanumDrive with a modifier.
        Parameters:
        fr - the front-right motor.
        fl - the front-left motor.
        br - the back-right motor.
        bl - the back-left motor.
        angleOffset - the angle offset to apply to any inputted translations.
        swapXY - should input translations have their X and Y values swapped? This is the very first modifier that gets applied - if X and Y values are swapped, and you set reflectX to true, you'll be reflecting what were originally Y values.
        invertX - should X values be reflected across the Y axis? Try changing this if your robot isn't moving in the right direction.
        invertY - should Y values be reflected across the X axis? Try changing this if your robot isn't moving in the right direction.
        turnMagnitude - the multiplier for magnitude calculation during zero-point turns. This value should typically be very low. To get a rough estimate of this value, take the maximum angle delta (unless you changed it, it will be 180 degrees) and multiply it so that it fits within the bounds of 0.0 to 1.0. A good starting place is 0.001.

      • setTranslation

        public void setTranslation(Translation translation)
        Set a translation to the drivetrain. This translation should always be relative to the robot, not relative to the field, yourself, or any other stationary object.
        Specified by:
        setTranslation in interface Drive
        Parameters:
        translation - a translation the robot should act upon. This translation should always be relative, meaning whatever the translation says should make the robot act accordingly according to the robot's position and the robot's current heading.
